Home → Schools → Costs

Costs

Choose from two services:

Self-service

Select and collect your own stock from the Suffolk Libraries collection with a self-service card. Only available for certain elements of the service.

Supported service

Our experienced staff use their specialist knowledge of children’s titles and the curriculum to choose for you. We'll also deliver directly to your school.

Primary schools
Element Overview Price (per annum)
Topic box loans A box of 20 books and related resources to support the teaching of curriculum topics. £50 per box per term
Classroom collections A box of 30 fiction and non-fiction books per class to support reading for pleasure. Large print and dual language available. These supported collections can be swapped twice a year if required. £70 per year
Teacher library card A self-service card for school staff to borrow up to 30 books from their local library. A valuable resource for a class visit to your local library. £35 per year
School library collection A loan of 150 fiction and non-fiction books to supplement the school library.
  • £175 per year: self-service
  • £250 per year: supported
Artefact service A box of themed artefacts to support curriculum topics. Each box has a termly loan period.
  • Up to 6 boxes: £150
  • Up to 9 boxes: £210
  • Up to 12 boxes: £270
  • Single pay as you use box £30
Group reader sets Each set contains 6 copies of a book to support reading development. Each set is a termly loan. £10 per set with a minimum order of 5 sets
Book cafés - at a time to suit your school Professional staff on hand to promote books and reading to staff, parents and pupils. Each pupil attending can borrow 1 book to take home. £195 per café event, or free if your school spends more than £2,000 and selects this option as part of your contract.
The bookshop Talk to us about buying books at a competitive discount. We select, order, process and supply the books so they are shelf ready for you.
Support and continuing professional development for primary school teachers
Element Overview Price (per annum)
Advisory librarian support Areas we can cover include developing or revitalising your school library, working with pupils to encourage reading for pleasure, information literacy skills and traditional storytelling
  • 1 day: £200
  • 2 days: £375
  • 3 days: £525
  • Half day: £125
Talking Books book group school staff (KS2) A termly group for school staff (librarians, support staff and teachers) to meet and disucss new books to promote is schools £30 per session or £50 for three sessions (covers one school year). Includes loaning of books.
Forum for Library Assistants in Primary Schools (F.L.A.P.S.) Professional termly forum for staff who work in primary school libraries £40 per session or £100 for three sessions (covers one school year).
Training courses A range of library and reading related courses for all primary school staff delivered in-house Individually priced, please ask for details
Secondary schools
Element Overview Price (per annum)
School library collection A loan of 150 fiction and non-fiction books to supplement the school library.
  • £175 per year: self-service
  • £250 per year: supported
Topic box loans A box of 20 books and related resources to support the teaching of curriculum topics. £50 per box per term
Teacher library card A self-service card for school staff to borrow up to 30 books from their local library £35 per year
Group reader sets Each set contains 6 copies of a book to support reading development. Each set is a termly loan £10 per set with a minimum order of 5 sets
Support and continuing development for secondary school teachers
Element Overview Price (per annum)
Advisory support for school librarians Professional librarian guidance for the school librarian and library assistant. Help and practical advice to develop the library into a vital learning resource in your school.
  • 1 day: £250
  • 2 days: £425
  • 3 days: £600
CPD programme

Termly county training day for school library staff. Delivered by professionally recognised external trainers.

Termly business meetings for secondary school staff. Knowledge sharing and peer support networking
  • £175 per day session or three sessions (one academic year) for £450
  • £60 per session or three sessions (one academic year) for £150
Book Mastermind Annual countywide competition to celebrate reading for Key Stage 3 pupils £160

Privacy & cookies

By using our site you agree to our use of cookies. Find out what cookies we use, how they affect you and how you can control them: our cookie policy.

Suffolk Libraries HMRC charity number is XT34476 and our registered company number is IP031542.
